title: Gagan Narang:His Father Sold His Property To Buy Gagan Narang A Rifle And He Shot India To Glory With A Cluster Of International Medals
text:
When we think of Indian shooters the name Gagan Narang is right up there with the rest of them. And why not? The man has brought a lot of glory to India on the shooting stage. Skillful with the gun, be it a pistol or rifle, he is an artist with the weapon in hand.

PTI

But the journey was not so easy for Gagan in the beginning. When his father gifted him an air pistol in 1997, he took to shooting and put improve his skills in their backyard. For proper training he needed a rifle and it cost money. His father had to sell his property to ensure that Gagan got a rifle. From then on there was no looking back.

He started off with a gold at the 2003 Afro Asian Games and it was from there that things really took off. A World Cup gold in 2003 was followed by 4 gold medals at the 2006 Commonwealth Games. But the biggest moment came when he won bronze at the 2012 Olympics. On the big stage he had a podium finish.

Gagan has been shooting India to glory on the international stage and he has a plethora of medals to back up that claim. 10 CWG medals, 1 Olympic medal, 5 Asian Games medals and 6 world medals - now that's a lot of medals won.

He is still representing India at the top level even now and it was his father's sacrifice all those years back which is bearing fruit. He is showing now signs of stopping and who knows, maybe he can sign off in a blaze of glory. Gagan has shot India to glory and he has more often than not been on target.
